captions.text: OSHO TALKS: silence shared in words
This talk is complete in itself.
These discourses are the foundations of your meditation.
Sitting with me in these discourses is nothing but creating more and more meditativeness in you.
I don't speak to teach something -- I speak to create something.
These are not lectures -- these are simply a device for you to become silent -- OSHO
You have often said that no improvement is needed,
no goal is there to be achieved.
And you have also spoken about how, in the buddhafield,
by those who are further along the path,
and can help those who are a few steps behind them.
Are there different stages of spiritual growth?
And if so, can you talk to us about them,
and how people in these different stages can be helpful to each other?
Because what it is on the first step,
so it is on the last step.
On the second step, you are witnessing
On the third step, you are witnessing the activities of the heart.
So if you look at witnessing,
it is just the same reality --
But if you look at the objects of witnessing,
then you can divide it into steps.
So the person who is witnessing only his bodily activities
can be immensely helped by the person
all the activities that the mind is capable of.
The person who is on the third stage
the first stage person and the second stage person,
because now he is witnessing very subtle moods,
And the person who has come to the fourth
The help is a kind of encouragement.
he can explain to you that whatever hindrances you are feeling
and your witnessing may be as soft as water,
and the rock simply disappears into sand.
At the first glance it seems that there is no way for the water to win.
How can it win over the rock?
Just somebody who has seen it happen
has to help you, that "Don't be discouraged by the rock,
it's strength. It is nothing before the water. "
Lao Tzu used to call his way the watercourse way --
You can put it into any form.
You put it in a bottle,
it takes the shape of the bottle.
it takes the shape of the jar,
But somebody has to say to you,
So as far as objects are concerned,
the body, the mind, the heart.
The fourth happens on its own accord.
at the very center of your being.
The seer is there, but there is nothing to see.
The awareness is there, but there is nothing to be aware of.
has nothing to be aware of,
And this is what we call realization.
You have known thousands of things;
for the first time, you know
You have been conscious of many things;
for the first time you become conscious of consciousness itself.
that people can be more advanced, less advanced,
I mean their objects of witnessing...
there may be nothing as an object.
That is the moment of revolution,
and that's the only revolution there is.
It opens the doors of all the mysteries of existence.
It allows you to feel the deathlessness,
that's why there is no way to say it,
Your emphasis has always been that every human being
has the birthright to become enlightened,
However, not many people claim this birthright,
or are even interested in it.
Why not? Is there some ingredient, some quality
interested in the inquiry than others?
The ego has no interest in it.
It is not something that the ego can
It would like to go to the moon,
but it would like to go to Everest.
but the ego gets interested only in things
in something which you are carrying, from the very birth, with yourself.
It is interested in extraordinary things.
the more the ego becomes interested in it.
And enlightenment is the easiest thing in existence,
Hence, ego has no interest in it.
This is how the problem arises.
The moment a child is born,
nobody is interested in the child's nature,
Nobody is interested in the child's birthright.
Everybody is interested in making of the child something
who is going to be in the history.
is the strength of your ego.
The farther you are from yourself,
perhaps it must have taken thousands of years,
so Buddhists must have done that.
Just before you go into the forest and into the caves,
I was finding somewhere to stay.
so many caves -- and I am not
within half an hour and come back --
so I wanted to stay for a few days,
because each cave may take days for me....
that you just go in and have a look
It is not a tourist place.
You have to be in that cave one day, two days, three days
to be acquainted with its vibe.
with those thousands of meditators who had worked
and they have not just painted
with a certain specific aim in mind:
that they will convey to people something
which cannot be said in words.
so many scriptures, what is the need
Seems to be a sheer waste of time.
So I was looking where to stay,
and then I came across a small temple.
I went in and I asked the priest,
"If you allow me to leave my
and -- it will be very kind of you --
to sleep here for two-three days,
because in your town there is no hotel."
The priest said, "But nobody stays here.
and within an hour, or two hours at the most,
I said, "I am not a tourist.
I am one of those who have carved these statues. "
The man looked at me as if I am mad!
you can leave your luggage in the temple."
on the door of the temple there was a sentence --
is respected in his own country,
is respected in the whole world.
You have spoiled the whole thing.
'A king is respected in his own kingdom.'
'The enlightened one is respected in the whole world,
And ego is the only barrier which does
not allow a man to become enlightened.
So if a person is trying to become enlightened to be respected
that he will become enlightened, ever."
But I can understand; whoever made that
that unless you make enlightenment an object of the ego,
nobody is even going to try.
that the ego becomes interested in it.
But whoever made the sutra is a fool.
that if ego is interested in becoming enlightened,
then there is no possibility for enlightenment.
The only barrier is the ego.
whether your name is written in golden letters in the history
Only then, when respectability does not matter at all
nobody seems to be interested in it.
then many idiots would have been trying to reach there.
wherever you go it is there with you,
Even while you are committing a crime, a murder,
If you can witness your murder,
It does not matter what you are doing.
What matters is: are you doing it
Perhaps as a witness you cannot murder,
But that is a separate story.
all are trying to make you ambitious.
and whether he has passed this year or failed.
we had to tell him, that "You have to sign it."
But I will sign." And he will sign without reading whether
any recommendations from the teacher, from the principal?
that was the first time I told him,
you know me, that I am good for nothing,
I have topped the whole university
some crime that I have committed.
You need not be so serious."
if you can top the university
then the people who are studying there
must be far worse than you!
That makes me serious. I was thinking only you are good for nothing.
This proves that your whole university
And you topped -- that means you are at least
I never thought about it, otherwise I would not have told you.
I thought you will be happy."
To get such a father is very difficult.
If some of my brothers failed in a class
and they came home crying and weeping,
he will say, "Don't cry and weep. What is the matter?
It simply means in two years
you will become far more stronger
and far more wiser than you can become in one year.
If you cannot come out of the school one year earlier,
You can take your time, you can fail as many times as you want.
One thing is certain, the more you remain in one class,
the wiser and stronger you will become --
"It is not our fault that your
but he never pays any attention
to the studies. He is continuously interested in games,
and almost always he is absent.
So you just tell him to be present. He is intelligent,
there is no problem about it.
But my father will say, "But what is the problem?
Let him play, let him not be attentive.
one year, two years, three years,
He will come out far more mature,
In life you cannot succeed in everything.
he will know some taste of failure
and will be able to absorb it in his life.
There is no need to be worried and no need to console me.
But to find this kind of
and because they cannot fulfill their own ambitions,
they project their ambitions on their children.
They wanted to become something special,
at least their son will become.
I used to know a very famous politician,
He had a very ambitious mind
and wanted to become not less than prime minister of India.
And the man who became the first prime minister of India,
Both have been together in jails,
both have come from very rich families.
The father of Jawaharlal Nehru, Motilal,
in one of his speeches has said, "I have two sons.
One is Jawaharlal, another is Govind Das."
thinking to become the prime minister.
If he cannot become the first prime minister,
his must be the second chance.
But he could not manage even to become a cabinet minister.
He could not manage even to become
a chief minister of a state.
and he was trying hard that they should
And he had all the connections,
so he helped his first son
He was hoping that soon he will become minister,
then he will move to the cabinet of the central government,
If he has not been able to become the prime minister,
at least he can claim to be the father of a prime minister,
But the son died as a deputy
He was only thirty-six when he died.
But ambition is such a thing
that this old man tried to commit suicide,
because with the death of the son
I told him: "You have another son.
You have all the best connections in the country,
from the lowest to the highest.
It is just very easy for you."
And suddenly I could see his eyes shine
as if life returned to him.
He said, "Yes, I had never thought about it.
I was simply thinking to die,
because what is the point of living?
I missed, my son has died."
So he managed for his second son to enter into the same post --
But neither of his sons had the
And you will be surprised that the second son also died.
And the man was now seventy-five or seventy-eight,
and this was too much of a shock.
Again he started talking about suicide.
Last time you had done something
and he dropped the idea of suicide. Now you do something,
again he is talking of suicide." I said,
"Don't be worried. People who talk of suicide never commit suicide.
People who commit suicide are those who never talk about it.
He was sitting again in the same posture,
and I said to him: "If you want to commit suicide, commit!
Why do you harass the whole family
the mayor of the city, the chief minister,
all have come to console me.
And he was sitting with a pile of telegrams
from all the ministers, and governors and --
India has thirty states -- and chief ministers --
and he was showing them to everybody who was coming.
I told him, "You don't seem to be interested in the death of the son.
You are more interested in these telegrams."
Just one man has not given him a telegram,
and about that he was feeling very hurt.
He was one of his old colleagues,
but then later on they became enemies in politics.
so he was continuously telling to everybody,
And I have made the man."
But it is not true that he has made the man.
to reach to the post, to any post.
He was a very ambitious, very cunning,
And I said, "You are so much interested
in telegrams, and you are not interested
in the death of your son.
Can you understand that you have lived your whole life in ambition?
You failed, your first son died,
your second son died, but your ambition --
You are ready to commit suicide
but you are not ready to drop the ambition.
As if ambition is far more valuable than life!"
And I said, "If you just want to project your ambition on somebody,
He said, "You are a genius, certainly!
I never thought about my son-in-law."
He had only one daughter and two sons.
And because he was so rich
the daughter was living with him,
and the son-in-law was also living with him.
He is just like a son to you.
and see whether he dies or not!
Why have these two sons died?
It seems they were not capable
to withstand the political pressures, challenges, worries.
And they were both young and there was no need to die so soon.
except that politics proved poisonous to them.
And this time things went well.
minister and Seth Govind Das died!
his son-in-law was thrown out of the ministry,
because he was just taken in because of his pressure,
So all the politicians had known him throughout his whole life.
And he had been in the freedom struggle,
and he was known as "father of the parliament."
in the whole world, except Winston Churchill,
who has been a member of parliament so long, continuously
So he was known as father of the Indian parliament.
Everybody knew him and everybody was obliged in many ways to him.
I said, "This is far better, because if you were thrown out before,
again he would have striven to commit suicide."
And he was not capable of committing suicide either,
The whole educational system is ambitious.
They are all promising and giving hope to people
that their ambitions will be fulfilled after death.
which needs a simple, very simple understanding --
and your whole life is transformed.
The whole earth can become enlightened.
Just, we have to change the educational system,
the organized religions of the world,
And we have to allow every child his way.
Even if he turns out to be a beggar,
he will be far more fulfilled
when forced to be a king.
He will not be happy to be a king,
that will not go according to his heart.
If he wants to play guitar, let him play guitar.
He will not become Yehudi Menuhin --
how many people can become Yehudi Menuhin?
But there is no need for everybody to become Yehudi Menuhin.
man who was practicing Indian classical music,
his neighbor came to him and said,
"Tonight we are going to have a party.
He said, "There is no problem, you can take the harmonium."
Just after a few minutes the neighbor's wife came,
"It doesn't look good, but we don't have a set of tablas.
But when is the party going to begin?"
The man said, "But your husband has taken the harmonium
and he was saying, 'We are going to have a party
so some music will be happening."'
So he had taken the harmonium, then we
remembered you may start playing on the tabla.
I have come to ask for the tablas
because what will we do with only the harmonium? -- tablas are also needed.
Just for so many days we have not been able to sleep.
Just once in a while, let us have sleep."
So if you are not disturbing your neighbors,
You can play your guitar, your sitar.
You can play anything you want,
and even if you don't become famous --
it is going to give to you, becoming famous.
you will be getting ten times more,
but what are you getting with twenty?
Two thousand people know you, then you will be getting
still more, but what are you getting with twenty?
Just think of that: the whole world knows you,
but what will you be getting out of it?
Just start with twenty and go on multiplying
able to perceive that it is simple nonsense.
Ambition is a very stupid game
in which there is no victory,
Only defeat because you will never become
what you are born to become.
And you will never know your birthright,
the ultimate bliss of being enlightened.
Often you have spoken about your rebellious
childhood and how it gave you such freedom,
how you insisted on discovering your own individuality.
How did you know the need to rebel at this early age?
What about those people who didn't have the courage to rebel
and who had a hampered childhood?
Is a rebellious childhood necessary for enlightenment?
If one is fortunate enough to be rebellious in his childhood,
I became enlightened when I was twenty-one.
Gautam Buddha became enlightened when he was forty-two,
because up to his twenty-ninth year
that these twenty-nine years have gone just
Because the astrologers have said to his father
that he should not be allowed to see
And he was the only son of his father,
and born at his very old age,
And the father was very much afraid
because the astrologers said, "If you don't manage
and may become a seeker of truth.
If he remains in the world
then there is a possibility he may
even become the king of the whole world,
he has such a great potential.
the great conqueror of the world --
in Sanskrit it is called chakravartin --
or he will become an enlightened one...
And we cannot say right now
then he will never renounce the world.
Bring the most beautiful girls of the kingdom.
Keep him surrounded with the girls,
with music, with dance, with wine, with good food.
for different seasons in different locations.
In summer he should be in a cold region.
In winter he should be in a warmer place.
Because India has very clear cut three seasons:
And the father was so rich, he managed beautiful palaces.
The gardeners were told that he should not see even
a pale leaf or a dead leaf.
No idea should get into his mind
that things get old or things die.
For twenty-nine years he lived almost
because he was going to open
some kind of Olympic Games for youth.
On the way in his golden chariot,
for the first time in his life.
The charioteer said, "I cannot speak a lie to you.
But what has happened to this man
happens to everybody -- he has become old."
"That means it is going to happen to me also?"
He was at his prime of youth,
"I would like it not to happen to you,
It is just the law of nature.
And then came a dead man's body
The charioteer said, "This happens after old age.
Buddha had not even heard the word death.
And then he saw a sannyasin,
And he said, "This man looks strange --
with a begging bowl in his hand --
I have never seen such a type.
He is a seeker of truth.
Realizing that life becomes one day
within us which does not die,
"Return the chariot back to my palace.
because I have already become old,
I am already feeling as if I am dying and suffocating.
You just take me back home.
And this was the first time
a great rebellion was born in his mind.
He could have become enlightened long before.
But one thing is certain: whether one
is rebellious in his childhood or not,
Because he will have to fight against the conditioning of the society,
he will have to rebel against the beliefs of the society.
He will have to rebel against his own ego,
And only after that one can relax
And then enlightenment is not far away.
You've said that your sannyasins live individual lives in freedom.
Doesn't everyone live an individual life?
What is the difference that makes a person a sannyasin?
that make a person a sannyasin.
that one does not know even
that "Life is slipping out of my hands.
and I have not even started the journey yet."
who may have found some meaning,
who may have reached the oasis.
While you are in the desert,
somebody may have found the sources
And it is not a question of any intellectual conviction.
one cannot give any explanation why,
but one knows that this is the man.
It is not of the head,
otherwise reason could have been supplied.
It is something of the heart,
Once you have found a man
any name you can give it --
no more any problems, no anxiety, no anguish,
the journey towards one's own self,
Something that was dormant in you
and you start flying with him
and then people went on coming
to become bigger and bigger and bigger.
because now you are no more
The whole world is full of zombies, sleeping people,
And when so many people gather around such a man,
All this happens without any planning --
I had never thought of any commune.
And soon it is going to become
And then the work becomes very easy,
because all these people are at different points in the journey
and they start helping each other.
They become sharers of my work,
they relieve me of much work.
almost many bodies and one soul.
Everybody's growth somehow helps your growth.
is going to help everybody else's enlightenment.
otherwise it is very difficult: how can I help millions of people?
of what it is all about,
go back to their own commune
So this place has already become a world capital of all the mystics,
of all the seekers of truth.
that it is not a religion,
because I want it to remain
and all our communes can become
that is the only hope for the world,
Otherwise, this century is going to see the end
of all life on this earth.
that death is more powerful than life,
that hate is more powerful than love,
that nuclear weapons are more powerful
and I am certain that we are capable of proving it.
